tasks.task: Purchase and care for chicks to ensure their survival and productivity.
subtasks: Research and select reputable suppliers to buy healthy chicks.
Provide warmth using brooders and central heating during cold weather.
Monitor temperature and noise levels to avoid health issues.
Regularly clean waterers and replace water daily to provide clean drinking water.
Sowment serve water before feed to prevent stampedes and maintain calmness.
Protect chickens from diseases by being aware of risks, seeking advice, and administering vaccinations.
Avoid using spoiled feeds by checking for mold and discarding any that appear suspicious.
Secure the chicken area from predators such as dogs, cats, and snakes.
Adhere to medication and vaccination schedules for optimal chicken health.
Manage litter by keeping it clean, dry, and free from ammonia buildup.
Maintain overall hygiene to prevent disease spread on the farm.
Ensure adequate feed supply to keep chickens well-fed and healthy.

tasks.task: Manage ammonia buildup in chicken litter.
subtasks: Clean and dry chicken litter regularly to prevent ammonia accumulation.

tasks.task: Implement disease prevention measures on a poultry farm.
subtasks: Be aware of disease risks affecting chickens.
Seek veterinary advice and guidance for disease prevention.
Vaccinate chickens according to recommended schedules.
Identify potential predators such as dogs, cats, and snakes.
Install physical barriers or fencing to keep predators out of chicken pens.

tasks.task: Adhere to a strict medication and vaccination schedule.
subtasks: Record vaccination dates and follow up on medication administration.
Ensure all chickens receive necessary medications and vaccinations as per schedule.

tasks.task: Provide clean and fresh water to chickens before and after feeding.
subtasks: Ensure waterers are clean and functional.
Regularly check and refill waterers before and after feeding sessions.
Inspect feed regularly for signs of spoilage or mold growth.
Dispose of any moldy feed promptly to prevent health issues in chickens.

tasks.task: Protect chicks from suffocation and temperature fluctuations.
subtasks: Monitor temperature levels in brooding areas to prevent overheating or hypothermia.
Ensure proper ventilation in chicken coops to prevent carbon dioxide buildup.

tasks.task: Maintain proper hygiene to prevent disease transmission on the farm.
subtasks: Clean chicken coops and equipment regularly.
Wash hands and wear clean clothing when handling chickens.

tasks.task: Feed chickens a sufficient quantity of quality feed.
subtasks: Monitor feed consumption to ensure chickens are getting enough nutrition.
Adjust feed amounts based on chicken age, activity level, and growth stage.
